dialogues.text: You are a man who saves others. (beat) Save my brothers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson almost laughs.  Her persistence is unbelievable

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm in a lot of trouble right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My brothers are in more trouble. They've moved them to ... an awful place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose.  Ed Witwer -he's in the most trouble of all.  Who saves him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose suddenly grimaces in pain, and grips the side of her head.  She curls into a fetal position. Anderson goes to her, touches her thin shoulder.  Her eye roll into the back of her head. Whose pain is she feeling?  Her own?  Someone else's? Anderson doesn't want to think about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because Anderson has destroyed the Precog Chamber, the tw Precog brothers have been brought here. The room is makeshift, uncomfortable ... a place for experiments.  The brothers are strapped into chairs.  The are helmeted. But unlike before, large bore needles have been placed in their jugular veins.  Connected to the needles are long t of IV tubing.  There are several IVs running at high drip rates. Witwer has his back to all this.  He stands with Dr. Resf watching a technician working the keyboard on a huge mainframe. Dr. Resfield, a man not given to squeamishness looks back the Precogs, uneasy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not really set up for this type of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He stops talking when he looks into Witwer's hollow eyes. is somewhere beyond the influence and reach of words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson tries to get Rose to drink some water.  Her skin translucent, unhealthy, glistening with sweat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose.  Try to drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pushes the cup away.  She closes her eyes, as if even the dim light of the room causes her pain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your wife.  We have to get her here, Anderson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She opens her eyes.  Anderson doesn't like the feel of th

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you seeing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Glimpses, Anderson.  Please.  We have to get her here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're scaring me, Rose

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She covers his mouth with her hand

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stop talking.  It uses me up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For a long time, Rose says nothing, Her gaze is locked on a distance beyond the room.  At last, she speaks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In three minutes your wife will take a walk ..

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa sits in her office.  But she can't stand it, the sit and waiting.  She has to move.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gets up and hurriedly leaves her office

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer walks past Lisa's SECRETARY toward the open door o Lisa's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir?  I'm sorry, she stepped out for a few minutes. (beat) Sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer stares into the empty office.  There is a clock on Lisa's desk.  His eyes fix on it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa moves quickly down the steps of the white marble building.  She takes a deep breath, then heads down Jeffe Boulevard toward the city. A sleek black TRANSPORT with two Precrime officers in it follows her from a discreet distance. In the sky above, the ubiquitous Precrime hovercraft

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa walks down the street.  She hugs herself, barely awa of her surroundings.  She passes by stores, restaurants, payphones, video kiosks ... oblivious.  People push past her. On a street corner, as she waits at a red light, the payp beside her begins to RING.  If she hears it, she gives no indication.  A KID reaches for it, listens, hangs up. She walks on.  Stores.  Restaurants.  An art gallery.  As she comes abreast of another PAYPHONE, it suddenly starts ring.  This time Lisa glances at it.  But again, walks on The TRANSPORT weaves through traffic, nearby She walks pa the K.L. Lawrence Graphics Museum.  And another restauran And a PAYPHONE.  And this time, finally, when it, too, RI she turns and looks hard at it. A man begins to walk over to it.  Lisa almost knocks him of the way to get to it.  She grabs at the receiver.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello?  Hello?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa's forehead sags against the side of the payphone.  S basks in the sound of him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's 1:03.  Set your watch, exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa pushes the buttons on her digital watch as she liste LISA Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is what you have to do ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We now hear ANDERSON continue in VOICE OVER as we follow Lisa through a SEQUENCE OF EVENTS ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa walks up the steps of the museum

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At 1:07 hang up the phone and enter the Lawrence Museum.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa walks quickly through a display of 19th century maga advertising.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Precrime officers walk into a room filled with Ch graphics.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At 1:13 the two Precrime officers following you take a wrong turn into a different room, losing sight of you for ten seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The officers start toward the entrance way to another roo then hesitate uncertainly, and go for another entrance wa

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa hurries down the steps

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa boards the "A" MagLev train

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An undercover transport officer will have received emergency orders to follow you. (MORE) He's wearing a red tie.  He has short blond hair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The blond transport officer with the red tie sits at the end of Lisa's car, watching her. At the next stop Lisa gets off.  He follows, not too far behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa starts up the stairs.  She looks at her watch, then makes herself pause a few moments, to keep within Anderso time frame.  She starts up again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As you come around the bend, cry out and turn around and slap the officer...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa does this, and the officer reels back, surprised. At same moment two big men rushing to catch a subway come in view, and see this happening.  Lisa starts to run.  When undercover officer tries to stop her, the two men grab th officer, and they get into a fight. Lisa escapes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa looks at her watch, then taps the window for the dri to stop.  She gets out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Stay on Ninth street.  Underneath Ninth street is the main power feed for The Sprawl.  It'll mess up the navigational beacon on the hovercraft. (beat) Keep switching taxis.  But stay on Ninth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She hails another taxi.  She holds her hand over the IdentiScan before it can read her.  The taxi driver looks her, sees her smile, sees the prepaid cash card she holds out to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred dollars if you don't scan me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's The Sprawl -- stranger things have happened.  He gra the card, and jerks his head for her to get in.  They tak off.

dialogues.speaker: EXT. NINTH STREET LATER
dialogues.text: Lisa gets out of the taxi and looks briefly into the sky. It is dense with holographic billboards, skim-jets, dirigibles.  Somewhere in all that is a Precrime hovercra And the neighborhood around her is definitely downscale.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The hovercraft will try to drop altitude, but the air traffic will slow it down. (beat) Precrime loses you.  You'll have to walk two miles.  Don't get scanned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa walks hurriedly down a side street.  She stands out her white dress -- a spot of vulnerable color in world of black. Too vulnerable to pass up.  A MAN in a gray overcoat slid out from between two buildings in front of her.  He is no coy about his intent.  He comes straight at her, all busi Lisa freezes in place.  She looks at her watch.  The man grabs her by the shoulder.  When she starts to scream, he claps his hand over her mouth, hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You bite me, bitch, I'll pull your teeth out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Her eyes look around frantically.  He starts to drag her backwards into the dark. ANDERSON leaps into view, and slams the man's head into a light post.  It takes a lot of slamming before lie loosen his grip on Lisa.  His legs at last collapse under him. Anderson scoops Lisa off the ground.  She hugs him hard. Then pulls back from him.  She gives him a look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut it a little close there, honeybunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose got the street wrong.  She's getting weak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose sits up in bed silently watching Lisa and Anderson together. Lisa needs to touch him.  She keeps a hand on his arm, br back a loose look of his hair.  Rose is mesmerized by her actions.  She drinks in everything, every bit of life. Anderson and Lisa are deep in conversation.  They speak t each other as if Rose were hardly present in the room. Anderson is trying to process everything Lisa has told hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two discs.  One fake.  One real.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think there were supposed to be two.  Whoever planned it, wasn't counting on two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They are silent for a long time.  Rose watches them work through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An infallible system.  Every disc ever generated has been true ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Somebody wants you out of the way -- so they make a fake disc.  Who ever doubts the discs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never doubted it.  I saw it.  And believed it, absolutely.  I was certain I was going to murder Witwer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson is shaking.  Lisa wraps her arms around him.  Hi voice is a stunned whisper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I saw the fake, and believed so much in the system, that I saw myself as a murderer. (beats) And the Precogs picked up those thoughts ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And generated the second disc.  The real one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A self-fulfilling prophesy.  I believed it was true.  And that made it true.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson and Lisa turn and look at Rose.  She lies curled the bed, her face to the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose.  If all this is based on a lie -the fake disc -- then do I really kill Witwer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) We see what we see.  I'm sorry, Anderson.  It's been predicted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Such a small voice, delivering a message of such finality

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Glaser tries to get through to Witwer.  Witwer back is turned to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can't take chances, sir

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer doesn't move or answer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It happens in less than three hours. (beat) We put you in a hovercraft and keep you airborne -- until after the event.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The event.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Glaser shifts uncomfortably

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've been ordered to get you onto the craft.  By force if necessary.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The event is inevitable, Lieutenant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer doesn't turn around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Precogs are never wrong.  The event will take place.  I'm a believer.  Aren't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't leave this room without you, sir.  The Security Panel insists.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson and Lisa keep working it, peeling away the layer Rose lies silent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nobody could slip a fake disc past Ennis Page Lisa shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was the weak link in the perfect system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Obsessive compulsive niners can't allow changes in the routine

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something threw him off. (beat) He tried to tell me.  It didn't make any sense.  Something about "spilled coffee." (beat) Someone was in his office with him. And coffee spilled ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We stay CLOSE ON Anderson and Lisa as Rose's voice cuts i

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were always treated as if we weren't alive.  As if we weren't there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pulls back and they are watching her as she continues to speak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Even now.  You forget that I'm here. You talk between yourselves.  And when you need me to see into the future, then you turn to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose.  What is it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) We weren't just lost in the future. We were in the Chamber, too.  Our eyes were open.  In the present.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And then Anderson gets it.  He kneels beside her bed

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your eyes were open.  What did you see, Rose?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who would I have told?  Who ever talked to us?  Who cared that we could talk?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose.  Who spilled the coffee? Straight ahead ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose stares stright ahead ...

dialogues.speaker: MEMORY HIT
dialogues.text: Rose sits in her chair in the Precog Chamber.  Her brothe sit in their usual places on either side of her.  The technicians tend to them. Rose's eyes are open.  She sees everything in the room. technicians, the machines ... and across the room a large window where she can see Ennis Page working the mainframe computer. Rose watches through the window ... As the computer emits discs, Page gathers them

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed Witwer entered Page's office.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer carries a mug of coffee. Ennis Page goes red in the face, stares at the coffee.  S to Witwer, angrily, pointing to the coffee.  We can't hea the words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page was so upset at the sight of the coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer goes to put the coffee down on a small table.  It tips, and spills. Page looks like his head will explode.  He pulls a neatly folded white handkerchief out of his back pocket and drop to his hands and knees and begins to obsessively blot at coffee stain on his spotless rug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed Witwer took a disc from his pocket, reached over Page and put it in one of the open cases.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer closes the case.  He looks through the window into the Precog Chamber, but the only one watching him is Rose and what does she matter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Page rises angrily from cleaning the rug.  Witwer shrugs apology and leaves the room.  Page stares after him.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: Rose is weeping.  She looks at Anderson and Lisa.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't understand what I'd seen. And I had no one to tell ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa puts her arms around Rose Anderson tries to comprehe what he has heard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ed ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lisa turns, and speaks softly to her husband.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The perfect system -brought down by a cup of coffee.  My god.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (long beat) He set into motion his own death. He didn't know it would go this far. (to Rose) What makes me leave this room?  If I stay here I won't kill him.  Right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Rose and her brothers have already answered that ques for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Glaser looks at his watch.  Witwer is still in his chair, turned away from him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see, if you think you can put me on a hovercraft and save me, then you don't believe in the infallibility of the Precog system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lieutenant Glaser has his orders.  He begins to approach. And as he does, Witwer swivels his chair around, and lift the weapon he has been holding and silently shoots Lieute Glaser in the forehead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what I do not want around me, are nonbelievers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer steps over the body as if it doesn't exist, and wa out of the office, locking the door behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer gets out his car and looks at the two story concre building that houses the lab.  The lights are out in all windows except the back section of the second floor.  The the lights burn brightly. Witwer sees Precrime officers posted at intervals around He smiles as if he knows something they don't.  He looks his watch.  It is a cool night, but his face is slick wit sweat. He walks to the entrance of the building.  An OFFICER 1s startled to see him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things quiet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir.  Should you ... be here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's been a development.  A body's been found in the Sprawl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're checking it out.  I need to see what the Precogs have seen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer is IdentiScanned.  The door opens and he goes in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Resfield looks up as Witwer strides into the lab, car a tv under his arm.  Witwer is the last person he wants t see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Borrowed this from the technicians' lounge.  You don't think they'll mind, do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You shouldn't be here, Director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dr. Resfield's eyes cut to a large digital clock on the w the red numbers ticking off time in seconds. Witwer looks for a plug, finds one.  Plugs in the tv.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no.  This is exactly where I should be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're under a lot of strain, Director.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer finds what he's looking for -- the continuous loop his murder by Anderson.  "Call Now!  Call Now!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And tv's so good for that -- soothes the mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer turns his sweaty face to Resfield and gives him a bright smile.  The scientist looks like he wants to run o of the room. Witwer takes him by the elbow and guides him toward the Precogs.  Two technicians hover over the Precogs adjustin IV's and turning dials on the Precogs's organic helmets. The Precogs wince and shiver with each turn of the dial. But they are no longer violently seizing -- they are too weak for that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bring me up to speed, Doc.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're getting nothing from them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And that's because ... ?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer still grips him by the elbow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you think they know where Anderson is?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's impossible to tell. (beat) We've done everything.  Maybe even too much.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They know how to find Anderson for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) They're the perfect machine, Doctor. You just have to know which button to push.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose looks like she's on fire.  Anderson wets another tow wrings it over the sink.  Lisa takes it, and wipes down R face and arms . Rose's lips are moving soundlessly.  Her eyes are shut ti She begins to writhe in bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Rose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One hour.  We hold it together for an hour, Witwer lives -- and I'm not a murderer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She won't last an hour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It suddenly looks much worse than that.  Rose's body cont horribly and she arches up off the bed.  Lisa can't contr her. Anderson reaches for her, wraps her in his arms, trying t hold and comfort her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She begins to wail as she thrashes in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's killed him, Anderson!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose stiffens into a seizure posture, then her body goes slack.  Anderson eases her back on the bed.  He stares at her, stricken. Her voice barely leaves her now

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't save my brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson reels at her words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did he kill both of them, Rose? Rose!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rose manages to speak, one last time.  Her whispered word damn him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it matter, Anderson?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson rises.  Looks down at Rose. It matters.  He starts to move, quickly. Lisa takes hold of his arm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you leave this room...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson kisses her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then I'm a cop, just trying to do hisjob.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He reaches for his duffel bag. When the door closes behind him, Rose turns her head slig and looks.  And then her eyes drift closed, as she goes t place deep within her own mind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He passes by several cars on the street.  But they're all auto-drive, they won't do him any good. So he smashes a store window within forty-five seconds a city police transport zooms up, lights flashing.  Two cit officers leap out of the transport.  They approach the smashed-in store window, weapons drawn.  Which is a mista Anderson rises into view behind them, and sonically blast small crater in the sidewalk they are standing on. As they trip and fall, he is already spraying them down w BindFoam. Their second mistake is they left the engine running to p the bank of Nits -Tracker lights on the car's hood and ro Anderson screeches off through the choking predawn street of The Sprawl, a beacon of light in the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DIGITAL CLOCK races through time.  Witwer reaches his hand up and touches the vanishing numbers. The camera pulls back, and we see Dr. Resfield and the tw technicians bound and gagged in a heap in the corner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when we see the lab in its entirety, there sprawled o the floor in front of his chair is one of the Precog brot A small rise of blood comes from a torn place in the back his skull. The other Precog sits very still in his chair.  He is sti connected to everything -- his helmet is in place, the TV drip into him.  His eyes are open, and when Witwer moves, the Precog's eyes follow him. Witwer can feel them on him.  He turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he coming?  No?  Yes?  Maybe? (beat) I think yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Precog looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you think yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer points to the tv screen, running Anderson's murder Witwer.  Witwer smiles triumphantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Infallibly, immutably yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Precog looks at him.  Witwer's smile vanishes, and suddenly strides across the room, and claps his hand over the Precog's eyes.  Then he turns, and stares again at th clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three officers stand thirty feet apart in front of the building, facing outward toward the parking lot, weapons cradled in their arms. Behind them is a line of yew bushes.  AS we watch, the of on the left is yanked off his feet backward into the bush Several moments pass, and the same thing happens to the officer on the right. The officer guarding the front entrance casually looks ri Then he looks hard.  He grips his weapon tight, and swing left.  No one there, either. ANDERSON drops him hard, from behind.  The officer crumpl onto the cement. But Anderson's not done with him.  Anderson lifts him up, struggles to drag him forward toward the entrance. Anderson holds him upright in place.  The man's head loll backward.  Which is.  Perfect for what Anderson needs to Anderson reaches his fingers towards the man's closed eye He pulls up on the eyelids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An IdentiScan over the entrance clicks on and reads the m eyes.  Access granted, the doors HISS open.  Anderson ent the building, dragging the officer with him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson enters the lab.  The very building sickens him. What he sees sickens him even more. The remaining Precog sits strapped into his chair.  Witwe sits beside him in the other Precog chair, the dead broth at his feet.  Witwer wears the dead Precog's helmet.  His hand is in his lap, holding a gun. He grins when Anderson appears.  He takes off the helmet, drops it on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I figured, since I can see the future, too, maybe I could get a little disc action going. (beat) Just kidding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson stares at his old partner.  Then he looks up at digital clock.  Five-seventeen AM.  Witwer looks too, the turns back to Anderson.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You find you been doing that a lot this week?  Looking at clocks? (beat) Three minutes to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson turns to the tv.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's never anything good on, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now Witwer smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There.  That's the old Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not the old Ed. You've lost it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer rises from the chair, the gun in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You lost it.  You went weak in the knees, partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not your partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer looks at him sadly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The air went out of you when Frank D'Ignazio killed himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He was guilty.  I accepted that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No you didn't.  The doubts were creeping in on you.  The lab trying to engineer more Precogs ... Malcolm pressuring you to expand ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer reaches out and gently touches the remaining Preco brother's cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Belief is the basis of the system. It was your job to be the ultimate believer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer is breathing hard.  He lifts a hand and wipes the sweat from his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when Frank died, you faltered. I'm a cop, I see into the hearts of men. (beat) And the thing about you is, you wouldn't have just walked away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Never been my style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer gives him the flicker of a smile

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Precrime needs to grow.  You would have stood in its way.  The Security Panel wouldn't have understood that. What you're capable of.  What a bulldog you are. (beat) Look what you've been doing to us all week.  Amazing.  You're the best.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So you took matters into your own hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I understood the threat.  I understood YOU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson looks at the dead Precog

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You killed a Precog.  You ended the system you wanted to protect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wrong.  This lab will make more. Believe it, Paul.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They look at the CLOCK.  Five-nineteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Knowing the exact moment of your death -it's made you crazy, Ed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer looks at the tv.  The TV REALITY is almost in sync with what is happening in the room. Witwer lifts his gun -- and then realizes something is terribly wrong. Anderson is standing there before him just as he is on th disc -- except there is a major difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sonofabitch!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson lifts up both hands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't bring your gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right.  No gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You see?!  That's exactly what I'm talking about.  You don't Believe!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson just looks at Witwer, raging at him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The system is infallible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANDERSON Doesn't Seem to be Witwer reaches behind him and pulls a second gun from out of his belt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess that's why I've always carried two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He tosses the gun to Anderson.  It clatters at Anderson's feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't have it both ways.  You don't want to die.  That's why you lured me here -- to kill me first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) But it you don't diet the system is flawed, and you couldn't live with that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer SHOOTS him once, in the right thigh.  Anderson cri out, falls to the concrete floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pick it up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson speaks through his teeth ANDERSON It doesn't hap Witwer looks frantically at the tv, at the clock. He reaches over and opens the dripmeter on a piggy back I feeding into the Precog's main line.  A thick, yellow flu begins to flow toward the Precog's jugular vein.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're killing him, partner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what choice, finally, does Anderson have?  He reaches for the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not do this, Ed Witwer trains his gun on Anderson.  Anderson trains his gun on Witwer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Ed ...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Witwer lowers his gun.  And stands there between Anderson and the doomed Precog. The yellow liquid has almost reached the Precog's jugular Anderson shoots Witwer, once in the heart.  Witwer is thr back across the room, against a wall, beneath the clock. Anderson drags himself to the Precog, and rips the yellow out of the main line.  The yellow drips onto the floor, mingling with Witwer's red. Anderson crawls to his friend, and cradles him.  Witwer whispers something, and Anderson leans close to hear him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now do you believe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anderson pulls away from Witwer, and lets him take his la breaths alone.

dialogues.speaker: DARKNESS
dialogues.text: And then, slowly emerging from the mists of darkness, a p beautifully proportioned FACE. It is Rose's face.  The camera pulls back and we see that she is lying on a grassy hillside.  Her brother is lying beside her. They are looking up at the night sky, at a sky filled wit stars. Rose stares up into the sky, and speaks in a soft voice t her brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James.  Can you guess what I'm thinking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (beat) NO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: James smiles.  And then, after a long moment, so does Ros
